result.execSummary:
The defendant Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $300 fine plus court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
-----------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

8:39 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez. Spanish interpreter Sarah St. John in court. 
Atty Daane requests time to speak to the deft. 
8:40am court in recess. 
9:25am Court in session. Appearances the same. 
Atty Daane recites agreement for the record; deft to plead guilty to amended count in 22CF94, deft to plead guilty to count 1 in 22CT80; $300 fine plus court costs, DNA sample plus surcharge. 
State will file an amended information, changing count 1 to misdemeanor bail jumping in 22CF94. 
Deft enters guilty plea to amended charge in 22CF94. 1 count of misdemeanor bail jumping; $300 fine plus court costs, DNA sample plus surcharge.
22CT80- Deft enters guilty plea. 
Plea is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made. 
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Court gives warning to deportation.

3:34 PM Defendant Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Maylon Onel Fajardo Lopez. Interpreter Artega in court, sworn by the clerk.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Selmek acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading, plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of her client.
Speedy reserved.
